commitMessage:
feat(ship): add --skip-tests parameter support to /ship command template

## What Changed
- Modified `.claude/commands/ship.md` template (26 lines changed)
  - Updated frontmatter argument-hint to document `[--skip-tests]` parameter
  - Added bash parsing logic in Step 1 to detect and extract flag
  - Updated two `hodge ship` command invocations to pass flag variable
  - Enhanced troubleshooting section with usage guidance and examples
- Added 5 comprehensive smoke tests to `src/lib/claude-commands.smoke.test.ts` (43 lines)
  - Test frontmatter documentation of parameter
  - Test bash flag parsing logic presence
  - Test flag pass-through to CLI commands
  - Test troubleshooting documentation completeness
  - Test "fix first" recommendation messaging
- Created feature documentation files (HODGE-361 exploration, build plan, test intentions)
- All 1348 tests passing, including 5 new smoke tests

## Why This Change
The `hodge ship` CLI command already supports `--skip-tests` to bypass quality gates for emergency situations, but the `/ship` AI slash command template had no way to expose this parameter. This created a gap for developers needing to commit work that doesn't pass quality gates (emergency hotfixes, WIP state preservation, broken test infrastructure).

Following exploration recommendation (Approach 1: Minimal Template Update), this implements simple parameter pass-through without additional prompts or validation, trusting developers to use responsibly.

## Impact
- **User Experience**: Developers can now use `/ship {{feature}} --skip-tests` for emergency scenarios
- **Backward Compatible**: Default `/ship {{feature}}` behavior unchanged
- **Discoverability**: Frontmatter and troubleshooting clearly document availability
- **Token Efficient**: Pure template update, no CLI code changes required
- **Well Tested**: 5 new smoke tests verify all template changes (22/22 tests passing)
- **Standards Compliant**: Follows all critical test standards (no subprocess spawning, no toolchain execution, test isolation, behavioral testing)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
